examples: The first trek to the summit of Mount Everest was a stunning exploit.

entries.meaning: (computing) A program or technique that exploits a vulnerability in other software.
examples: For example, you can create PE files that are valid PDF exploits or valid ZIP files, valid JPG files, and so on.

entries.meaning: (by extension, Internet, video games) An action or technique that takes advantage of the conditions of a video game to gain an advantage, or to disadvantage others.

verbs.description: exploit (third-person singular simple present exploits, present participle exploiting, simple past and past participle exploited)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To use for oneâ€™s own advantage.
(transitive) To forcibly deprive (someone) of something to which she or he has a natural right for one's own benefit.
examples: Materialistic people who exploit others will come to a bad end.
